page.title: 12FARMING:HILLY FARM, RUSHDEN
page.content: Hilly Farm has about 11 acres in ourÂ£D' block.Mrs Willmott told us the land had been drained,so the soil was light.If it had not been,the land would be marshes.Mr Willmott is a thatcher as well as a farmer,so he grows his own straw for thatching.The wheat is a spec -ial type called Huntsman,it has espec- ially long stalks.Modern machinery can- not be used to harvest the wheat be- cause it crushes the straw which makes it useless for thatching.Instead a machine called a binder is used.A threshing machine is used after the wheat has been in the fields for 1-2 weeks,to remove the grains from the straw.Then the straw is stored in a Dutch barn.The straw that was too short for thatching would be used as animal bedding, and some would be sold to make corn dollies.The grains would be sold to millers to be ground into flour.
